Dear Melanie Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12310 – Initial Evaluation
Section
Description (3) The report shall be an assessment of all of the following:
(f) Safety and maintenance of the applicant’s house and
property, including but not limited to: sufficient beds and sleeping
space, pets, guns and other weapons, and water hazards.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Home had a basement bedroom without required egress.
Investigation This was an anonymous complaint, so the complainant was not
interviewed for any additional information.
I interviewed the Chief Administrator on 7/05/2023. The Chief
Administrator provided the name of the foster care worker, foster
care supervisor, and foster home associated with the complaint.
The special investigation dated 4/7/22 was reviewed and indicated
the foster family was instructed to dismantle the bed in the
basement bedroom as a part of the special investigation.
Documentation was received to confirm the bed was dismantled.
I reviewed the initial foster home evaluation dated 1/20/21 and
renewal foster home evaluation dated 11/23/21. Each of those
evaluations reported the existence of the bedroom in the
basement but did not include any instructions to the foster family
to remove the basement bedroom. The description of the home
indicated the basement did have the required egress window, but
the bedroom did not have the required egress window for
compliance with licensing requirements.
Analysis The foster family was instructed to dismantle the bedroom in the
basement of the home as a part of a special evaluation and
appropriate documentation was provided to confirm the bedroom
in the basement no longer existed. However, at the time of the
initial evaluation of the home and the subsequent renewal
evaluation of the home the bedroom in the basement was
reported but there was no instruction to the foster family that they
needed to dismantle the bed and eliminate the bedroom in the
basement for compliance with licensing requirements.
Conclusion Violation Established
